column1: abbreviated_fact‡fact
Fact: The world’s oldest film‡The world’s oldest film is only 2 seconds long.
Fact: The first toy advertised on TV‡The first toy advertised on TV is Mr. Potato Head.
Fact: The oldest language‡The oldest language that is still currently spoken is Tamil.
Fact: The search for the Titanic‡The search for the Titanic was a coverup.
Fact: Humanity received the first extraterrestrial signal‡Humanity received the first extraterrestrial signal in 1977.
Fact: Thomas Jefferson‡Thomas Jefferson broke his wrist while trying to impress a girl.
Fact: A mathematician‡A mathematician once fought a duel to prove a formula and lost his nose.
Fact: Romans‡Romans used urine as mouthwash.
Fact: The Phoenix Lights‡The Phoenix Lights were the best-documented UFO sighting.
Fact: Albert Einstein‡Albert Einstein could’ve been the president of Israel.
Fact: Thomas Edison‡Thomas Edison didn’t invent the lightbulb.
Fact: No one‡No one knows what the Voynich Manuscript means.
Fact: Nobody‡Nobody has found Jack the Ripper.
Fact: Russian dictator Joseph Stalin‡Russian dictator Joseph Stalin edited photos for censorship.
Fact: Chinese women‡Chinese women used to bind their feet.
Fact: The Guanajuato Mummies‡The Guanajuato Mummies might have been buried alive.
Fact: No one‡No one knows where Klerksdorp spheres came from.
Fact: Winston Churchill‡Winston Churchill smoked 8 to 10 cigars a day.
Fact: King Tut’s parents‡King Tut’s parents were brothers and sisters.
Fact: The use of the word “hooker”‡The use of the word “hooker” originated in the late 1800s.
Fact: Flour sacks‡Flour sacks were colorful during the Great Depression.
Fact: The Zodiac Killer‡The Zodiac Killer is still unnamed.
Fact: The British Royal Air Force‡The British Royal Air Force accidentally sunk a ship full of holocaust victims in 1945.
Fact: The fate of the Roanoke colony‡The fate of the Roanoke colony remains unknown.
Fact: The Soviet Union‡The Soviet Union and the United States were supposed to go to the moon together during the Cold War.
Fact: A helicopter‡A helicopter was once found in an Egyptian petroglyph.
Fact: There’s no confirmed purpose‡There’s no confirmed purpose for the Roman dodecahedrons.
Fact: The Mary Celeste‡The Mary Celeste was the first ghost ship.
Fact: The Aegean Sea‡The Aegean Sea owes its name to a man who jumped in it and died.
Fact: Ancient Egypt‡Ancient Egypt may have had the first health-care plan in the world.
Fact: Persians‡Persians had a drinking tradition for hard decisions.
Fact: A key‡A key could have saved the Titanic.
Fact: The Salem Witch Trials‡The Salem Witch Trials never burned anyone at the stake.
Fact: The Epic of Gilgamesh‡The Epic of Gilgamesh is known as the oldest written story.
Fact: Women‡Women used to wear muzzles as punishment in the 17th century.
Fact: Space travel‡Space travel was first proposed in the 1600s.
Fact: Fidel Castro‡Fidel Castro survived over 600 assassination attempts.
Fact: Mary‡Mary had a little lamb for real.
Fact: Joan of Arc‡Joan of Arc inspired the bob haircut.
Fact: Women‡Women once marched for the right to smoke.
Fact: Nobody’s found the tomb‡Nobody’s found the tomb of Antony and Cleopatra.
Fact: People‡People used to think forks were blasphemous.
Fact: Christopher Columbus‡Christopher Columbus didn’t discover America.
Fact: The Olympics‡The Olympics used to have competitions for art.
Fact: Benjamin Franklin‡Benjamin Franklin jokingly hated the national bird.
Fact: Walt Disney‡Walt Disney didn’t draw Mickey Mouse.
Fact: The government‡The government approved The Declaration of Independence on July 2nd
Fact: People‡People didn’t commit mass suicide on Black Tuesday.
Fact: Pocahontas and John Smith‡Pocahontas and John Smith didn’t fall in love.
Fact: Europe‡Europe had the first car
Fact: Albert Einstein‡Albert Einstein never failed his math tests.
Fact: The first person‡The first person rested in a cryonic chamber in 1967.
Fact: The Kentucky meat shower‡The Kentucky meat shower is still unexplained.
Fact: Napoleon Bonaparte‡Napoleon Bonaparte was once hounded by rabbits.
Fact: A man‡A man once died because of a falling tortoise.
Fact: A Japanese soldier‡A Japanese soldier never realized WWII was over until 1974.
Fact: The Great Molasses Flood‡The Great Molasses Flood killed 21 people and injured 150 others in Boston.
Fact: Hitler‡Hitler was extremely gassy.
Fact: Mozart‡Mozart once wrote a six-piece canon titled
Fact: Benito Mussolini‡Benito Mussolini wrote a romance novel
Fact: Marie Antoinette‡Marie Antoinette Never Said “Let Them Eat Cake”
Fact: A 17-year-old‡A 17-year-old designed the American flag for school.
Fact: A lot‡A lot of history’s biggest disasters were caused by a lack of sleep.
